column4: Where should I start troubleshooting to figure out why my Brother mfc-j615 AIO scanner unit isn't detected across the local network? I've installed the brother print and scan drivers, and printing works fine, but the scanner is not recognized. I've googled this and read whatever I can find on Brother's support site, but I'm not getting anywhere. Thanks for any help.
have you installed the scanner drivers from the brother site? they make linux drivers you know ;)
That's why I purchased a Brother. Read my whole post.
Sorry for sounding rude, it wasn't meant that way.
its cool
so if you use simple scan, what message do you get?
It's all installed, like I said, and I've followed the directions at
Sorry didn't see your last message. "No Scanners Available" and No Scanners Connected"
is your OS 32bit or 64bit?
32bit
try:  wget http://www.brother.com/pub/bsc/linux/dlf/brscan3-0.2.11-4.i386.deb; sudo dpkg -i ./brscan3-0.2.11-4.i386.deb; rm ./brscan3-0.2.11-4.i386.deb
there is also a set of brother drivers in the repos, may work
I'm trying your instructions. I already installed the brother drivers from the repository earlier.
Do I need to reboot after installing that driver?
don't think so
Still doesn't work. Could it have something to do with the network configuration, even if the printer is working on the network?
Have any idea if I should be worried about my network configuration interfering with recognition of the AIO scanner if its printer is being recognized?
none at the moment, tbh I don't use scanners
have you tested RAM health?
have you set another shortcut to it? If you use terminal a lot, I suggest you install guake :)
no, it just quit working after update. I'll check ccsm and keyboard settings.
